Package moulton.scalable.texts

Class StaticTextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
        • moulton.scalable.texts.TextBox
          • moulton.scalable.texts.StaticTextBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TouchResponsiveComponent, DraggableComponent, ScrollableComponent, HotkeyTextComponent, TextInputComponent
    public class StaticTextBox
extends TextBox
    In some instances, the user will find it useful to select and/or copy text from a text box, but should not be able to edit its values. This class is made for that very purpose. If the contents of this text box need to be modified, they can still be altered through TextBox.setMessage(String) but not through appendMessage(String) or TextBox.removeMessage(int, boolean).
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
        message - the string displayed in the box
        parent - the panel that this text box will reside upon
        x - the x coordinate of this text box in its parent's grid
        y - the y coordinate of this text box in its parent's grid
        font - the font for the box
        color - the background color for the box when editable

    • Method Detail

      • removeMessage

        public void removeMessage​(int chars)
        The user cannot modify the static text box by typing commands, so this method overrides the action of TextBox and does nothing.
        Specified by:
        removeMessage in interface TextInputComponent
        Overrides:
        removeMessage in class TextBox
        Parameters:
        chars - the number of chars to be removed from the message. If there is a selection, 1 of these characters will be used to delete it. If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from right to left (backspace). If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from left to right (delete).

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • cut

        public java.lang.String cut()
        Cut commands are invalid, so the value of TextBox.copy() is returned instead.
        Specified by:
        cut in interface HotkeyTextComponent
        Overrides:
        cut in class TextBox
        Returns:
        the text from this component that should be copied to the clipboard
